==Plot== ''Life Is Strange'' is set in the fictional town of Arcadia Bay, [[Oregon]], and is told from the perspective of Maxine "Max" Caulfield (Hannah Telle), a twelfth grade student attending Blackwell Academy during October 2013. During photography class with her teacher Mark Jefferson (Derek Phillips), Max experiences a vision of a lighthouse being destroyed by a swelling [[tornado]]. Leaving for the restroom to regain her composure, she witnesses classmate Nathan Prescott (Nik Shriner) accidentally kill a woman in a fit of rage. In a single, sudden effort, she develops the ability to [[Time travel|rewind time]] and rescues the girl; revealed to be her childhood friend Chloe Price ([[Ashly Burch]]). The two reunite and go for a walk at the lighthouse, where Max reveals to Chloe her capacity to travel back in time. It is established that the vision is rather the reckoning of a future event: a storm approaching the town.<ref>{{cite video game|title=Life Is Strange|developer=Dontnod Entertainment|publisher=Square Enix|date=30 January 2015|platform=Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox One, Xbox 360|level=Chrysalis}}</ref> The next day, Max observes fellow student Kate Marsh (Dayeanne Hutton) being bullied for a [[viral video]] depicting her kissing several students at a party. It is implied that she was [[Drug facilitated sexual assault|drugged]], and Max suspects Nathan as the perpetrator.<ref name="chrysal15">{{cite video game|title=Life Is Strange|developer=Dontnod Entertainment|publisher=Square Enix|date=24 March 2015|platform=Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox One, Xbox 360|level=Out of Time}}</ref>
Meeting Chloe at the diner where her mother Joyce (Cissy Jones) works, they decide to experiment with Max's power at Chloe's secret scrapyard hideout. However, strain causes Max to have a nosebleed and faint. Chloe takes her back to Blackwell, but class is halted when everyone is called out to the courtyard. Kate commits suicide by jumping off the roof of the girls' dorm. Max manages to rewind and time stops unexpectedly as she reaches Kate, giving Max the opportunity to convince her to come down. Max ultimately resolves to uncover what happened to Kate and Chloe's missing friend Rachel Amber.<ref name="chrysal15" /> Max and Chloe break into the principal's office that night to investigate and enter the pool for a swim before evading David Madsen (Don McManus), head of security at Blackwell and Chloe's stepfather, and fleeing back to Chloe's place. The next morning, they sneak into the [[motorhome]] of Frank Bowers (Daniel Bonjour), drug dealer and friend of Rachel, and learn that Rachel was in a relationship with Frank and lied to Chloe about it, causing Chloe to storm off feeling betrayed. Max returns to her dormitory and examines a childhood photo of her and Chloe, but is suddenly transported to the day the picture was taken. Max prevents Chloe's father William ([[Joe Ochman]]) from dying in a traffic collision, which inadvertently creates an [[Multiverse|alternative reality]] where William is alive but Chloe has been [[Paralysis|paralysed from the neck down]] as a result of a collision in her own car.<ref>{{cite video game|title=Life Is Strange|developer=Dontnod Entertainment|publisher=Square Enix|date=19 May 2015|platform=Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox One, Xbox 360|level=Chaos Theory}}</ref>
Max uses the photo to undo her decision and return to the present day, restoring Chloe's health. Continuing their investigation, Max and Chloe obtain clues leading them to an abandoned barn owned by the influential Prescott family. They discover a hidden bunker containing pictures of Kate and Rachel tied up and intoxicated, with Rachel being buried at Chloe's secret hideout. They hurry back to the scrapyard and find Rachel's grave, much to Chloe's despair. Max follows Chloe at the school party to confront Nathan, believing he will target fellow student Victoria Chase (Dani Knights). They receive a text from Nathan threatening to destroy the evidence, returning them to the scrapyard. All of a sudden, the two are ambushed by Jefferson, who [[Anesthesia|anaesthetises]] Max and kills Chloe with a shot to the head. Max is kidnapped and held captive in the "[[Darkroom|Dark Room]]", a place Jefferson has been drugging and photographing young girls to capture their innocence. Max escapes into a photograph and emerges back at the beginning in Jefferson's class. She alerts David, getting Jefferson arrested.<ref>{{cite video game|title=Life Is Strange|developer=Dontnod Entertainment|publisher=Square Enix|date=28 July 2015|platform=Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox One, Xbox 360|level=Dark Room}}</ref>
Max is given the opportunity to go to [[San Francisco]] and have one of her photos displayed in an art gallery. She calls Chloe from the event, realizing that, for all her effort, the storm has reached Arcadia Bay. Max travels back to the time at which she took the gallery photo, which eventually leads her to sojourn alternative realities as they devolve into a [[dream]]scape nightmare. Max and Chloe finally return to the lighthouse and confront the fact that Max brought the storm into existence by saving Chloe from being shot by Nathan earlier in the week. The only way to prevent it is for Max to go back to that moment via a photo she took and allow Chloe to be killed by Nathan. Max must make a choice: sacrifice Chloe's life to save Arcadia Bay, or sacrifice Arcadia Bay to spare Chloe.<ref name="Life Is Strange">{{cite video game|title=Life Is Strange|developer=Dontnod Entertainment|publisher=Square Enix|date=20 October 2015|platform=Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox One, Xbox 360|level=Polarized}}</ref> <!-- DO NOT ADD THE AFTERMATH OF THE CHOICES HERE; WE ONLY DETAIL WHAT HAS TO HAPPEN -->
==Development== [[File:Raoul Barbet and Michel Koch of DONTNOD Entertainment (Life Is Strange) at GDC 2016 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Co-game directors Raoul Barbet and Michel Koch present at the 2016 [[Game Developers Conference]].]] ''Life Is Strange'' was [[Dontnod Entertainment]]'s second title with a female protagonist. Dontnod published a developer diary that said most prospective publishers were unwilling to publish a game unless it had a male protagonist.<ref name="square1">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/other-publishers-told-us-to-make-it-a-male-lead-ch/1100-6424577/ |title="Other Publishers Told Us to Make It a Male Lead Character," Life is Strange Dev Says |first=Emanuel |last=Maiberg |date=10 January 2015 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=21 July 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150719152644/http://www.gamespot.com/articles/other-publishers-told-us-to-make-it-a-male-lead-ch/1100-6424577/ |archivedate=19 July 2015 }}</ref><ref name="square2">{{cite web|url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/news/view/139401-Publishers-Disliked-Dontnods-Life-is-Strange-Having-Female-Leads|title=Publishers Wanted Life is Strange Devs to Make Leads Male|first=Sarah|last=LeBoeuf|date=11 January 2015|publisher=''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]''|accessdate=12 January 2015|archivedate=6 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150206164909/http://www.escapistmagazine.com/news/view/139401-Publishers-Disliked-Dontnods-Life-is-Strange-Having-Female-Leads|deadurl=no}}</ref> Most publishers had the same objection to Dontnod's first project, ''[[Remember Me (video game)|Remember Me]]''.<ref name="first">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/publishers-said-you-cant-have-a-female-character-says-remember-me-dev/1100-6405550/|title=Publishers said 'You can't have a female character,' says Remember Me dev|first=Eddie|last=Makuch|date=19 March 2013|publisher=''[[GameSpot]]''|accessdate=12 November 2014|archivedate=29 December 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131229210302/http://www.gamespot.com/articles/publishers-said-you-cant-have-a-female-character-says-remember-me-dev/1100-6405550/|deadurl=no}}</ref> Dontnod CEO Oskar Guilbert also challenged the idea at the start.<ref name="3dg3">{{cite magazine|title=Edge #293|first=Ben|last=Barnes|magazine=[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]]|location=p. 94-97|publisher=[[Future plc]]|date=June 2016}}</ref> [[Square Enix]] was the only publisher with no intention to change the female protagonist.<ref name="hip to be square">{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/publishers-wanted-to-change-life-is-stranges-protagonis-1678811522 |title=Publishers Wanted To Change Life Is Strange's Protagonists Into Men |first=Mike |last=Rougeau |date=11 January 2015 |publisher=''[[Kotaku]]'' |accessdate=31 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151117104746/http://kotaku.com/publishers-wanted-to-change-life-is-stranges-protagonis-1678811522 |archivedate=17 November 2015 }}</ref> Dontnod co-founder Jean-Maxime Moris said [[gender equality]] in video games was "a great debate to have",<ref name="50%" /> but "we're not pretending to address the issue or use the issue to stand out from the rest".<ref name="characters">{{cite web|url=http://thegamefanatics.com/2014/10/12/life-strange-brief-yet-delightful-look-next-game-behind-developers-remember|title=Life is Strange A Brief yet Delightful Look at the Next Game Behind the Developers of Remember Me|first=Carlos|last=Ovalle|date=12 October 2014|publisher=''The Game Fanatics''|accessdate=12 November 2014|archivedate=12 November 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112072937/http://thegamefanatics.com/2014/10/12/life-strange-brief-yet-delightful-look-next-game-behind-developers-remember|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Development of ''Life Is Strange'' began in April 2013 with a team of 15, and more people were added when the collaboration with Square Enix began.<ref name="development">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/videos/life-is-strange-developer-diary-a-new-beginning/2300-6422919/ |title=Life is Strange – Developer Diary: A New Beginning |first=Gajan |last=Kulasingham |date=9 January 2015 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=21 July 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150209052241/http://www.gamespot.com/videos/life-is-strange-developer-diary-a-new-beginning/2300-6422919/ |archivedate=9 February 2015 }}</ref><ref name="team">{{cite web|url=http://www.momenta.online/2016/02/edouard-caplain-on-the-art-behind-life-is-strange/|title=Edouard Caplain on the Art Behind Life Is Strange|date=9 February 2016|publisher=''Momenta''|accessdate=18 February 2016|archivedate=27 July 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160727023538/http://www.momenta.online/2016/02/edouard-caplain-on-the-art-behind-life-is-strange/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Dontnod told Square Enix about ''Life Is Strange'' only after Square Enix turned down a [[Sales presentation|pitch]] for a larger game.<ref name="solicited success" /><ref name="pitch on">{{cite web|url=http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/they-originally-pitched-a-different-game-how-square-enix-discovered-life-is-strange/0153982 |title='They originally pitched a different game': how Square Enix discovered Life Is Strange |first=Christopher |last=Dring |date=7 August 2015 |publisher=''[[Market for Home Computing and Video Games|MCV]]'' |accessdate=31 March 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160506210100/http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/they-originally-pitched-a-different-game-how-square-enix-discovered-life-is-strange/0153982 |archivedate=6 May 2016 }}</ref> Before signing with Square Enix, ''Life Is Strange'' was imagined as a full-length video game that Dontnod would self-publish. However, the publisher surmised that it would be more successful as an episodic title.<ref name="3dg3" /> The game was originally codenamed ''What If'' but then retitled to distinguish itself from the [[The F Word (2013 film)|film of the same name]].<ref name="what if">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/square-enix-s-life-is-strange-considered-100-diffe/1100-6425742/ |title=Square Enix's Life is Strange Considered 100 Different Names |first=Eddie |last=Makuch |date=6 March 2015 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=7 March 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150307215843/http://www.gamespot.com/articles/square-enix-s-life-is-strange-considered-100-diffe/1100-6425742/ |archivedate=7 March 2015 }}</ref> ''Life Is Strange'' was born of the idea for the rewind mechanic, which the developer had already experimented on with their last game ''Remember Me''. The lead character Max was created with the ability to rewind time to supplement this mechanism.<ref name="birth">{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2015/5/19/8612335/life-is-strange-making-of |title=How adventure game Life is Strange blends time travel and teen drama |first=Andrew |last=Webster |date=19 May 2015 |publisher=''[[The Verge]]'' |accessdate=19 May 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150520104539/http://www.theverge.com/2015/5/19/8612335/life-is-strange-making-of |archivedate=20 May 2015 }}</ref> The episodic format was decided upon by the studio for creative reasons, financial restrictions<ref name="format">{{cite web|url=http://www.usgamer.net/articles/life-is-stranges-triforce-of-influences|title=Life is Strange's "Triforce" of Influences|first=Kat|last=Bailey|date=31 January 2015|publisher=''[[Eurogamer#Subsidiaries|USgamer]]''|accessdate=1 February 2015|archivedate=2 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150202123538/http://www.usgamer.net/articles/life-is-stranges-triforce-of-influences|deadurl=no}}</ref> and [[marketing]] purposes,<ref name="aggregated" /> allowing them to tell the story in its preferred slow pace.<ref name="slow pace">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/apr/26/life-is-strange-episodic-video-game-dontnod |title=Life Is Strange: episodic video games prove as addictive as episodic TV |first=Calum |last=Marsh |date=26 April 2015 |publisher=''[[The Guardian]]'' |accessdate=26 April 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518090434/http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/apr/26/life-is-strange-episodic-video-game-dontnod |archivedate=18 May 2015 }}</ref> The [[Pacific Northwest]] was picked as the setting for the purpose of conveying a [[Nostalgia|nostalgic]] and autumnal feel to the game.<ref name="setting">{{cite web|url=http://gamerhub.tv/videos/life-is-strange-gameplay-preview-interview/2014/08/27/|title=Life Is Strange Gameplay Preview Interview|date=27 August 2014|publisher=''GamerHub''|accessdate=11 November 2014|archivedate=12 November 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112032016/http://gamerhub.tv/videos/life-is-strange-gameplay-preview-interview/2014/08/27/|deadurl=no}}</ref> The development team visited the region,<ref name="shortlong" /> took photographs, looked at local newspapers and used [[Google Street View]] to make sure the environment was accurately portrayed.<ref name="archetypes" /><ref name="googlestreetview">{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2015/01/29/life-is-strange-pc-ps4-xbox-one-video/|title=Final Life is Strange developer diary focuses on music, voice actors|first=Stephany|last=Nunneley|date=29 January 2015|publisher=''[[VG247]]''|accessdate=29 January 2015|archivedate=29 January 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150129233119/http://www.vg247.com/2015/01/29/life-is-strange-pc-ps4-xbox-one-video/|deadurl=no}}</ref>
It was decided early on that most of the budget be spent on the writing and voice actors.<ref name="release schedule 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-03-18-publishers-wanted-life-is-stranges-main-character-to-be-a-guy-qtes-added|title=Life is Strange dev talks lip-syncing, release schedule and publisher demands|first=Tom|last=Phillips|date=18 March 2015|publisher=''[[Eurogamer]]''|accessdate=18 March 2015|archivedate=18 March 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150318133732/http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-03-18-publishers-wanted-life-is-stranges-main-character-to-be-a-guy-qtes-added|deadurl=no}}</ref> The original story was written in French by Jean-Luc Cano, and converted into a game script by the co-directors and design team. It was subsequently handed over to Christian Divine and Cano to be fine tuned in English.<ref name="script process">{{cite web|url=http://www.redbull.com/en/games/stories/1331743857254/life-is-strange-interview |title=Be kind, rewind: The making of Life Is Strange |first=Damien |last=McFerran |date=28 August 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150831002923/http://www.redbull.com/en/games/stories/1331743857254/life-is-strange-interview |archivedate=31 August 2015 }}</ref><ref name="cano">{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-04-09-life-is-strange |title=Life is Strange team talk fan theories, that season finale and more |first=Tom |last=Phillips |date=18 April 2016 |publisher=''[[Eurogamer]]'' |accessdate=20 April 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160420131057/http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-04-09-life-is-strange |archivedate=20 April 2016 }}</ref> Story and [[Character arc|character development]] were highlighted over [[Graphic adventure game#Point-and-click adventure|point-and-click]] puzzles,<ref name="highlighting">{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2015/01/13/life-is-strange-is-for-telltale_heavy-rain-fans/|title=Life is Strange: "this is definitely a game for the Telltale and Heavy Rain fans"|first=Brenna|last=Hillier|date=13 January 2015|publisher=''[[VG247]]''|accessdate=20 July 2015|archivedate=13 January 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150113184014/http://www.vg247.com/2015/01/13/life-is-strange-is-for-telltale_heavy-rain-fans/|deadurl=no}}</ref> making choice and consequence integral to how the narrative unfolds.<ref name="choice">{{cite web|url=http://www.polygon.com/2014/8/11/5990851/life-is-strange-dontnod-entertainment-ps4-ps3-xbox-one-360-pc|title=Life is Strange, episodic adventure game, coming from Remember Me dev|first=Samit|last=Sarkar|date=11 August 2014|publisher=''[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]''|accessdate=11 November 2014|archivedate=6 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150206232452/http://www.polygon.com/2014/8/11/5990851/life-is-strange-dontnod-entertainment-ps4-ps3-xbox-one-360-pc|deadurl=no}}</ref> Hannah Telle auditioned for Max Caulfield in July 2014 and was offered the part; [[Ashly Burch]] auditioned for both Max and her given role Chloe Price. The recording sessions were done in [[Los Angeles]], California, with the French developer brought in via [[Skype]].<ref name="audition 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/09/12/hannah-telle-involvement-in-life-is-strange-is-the-greatest-honor-2/166374/ |title=Hannah Telle: Involvement in Life Is Strange is the 'Greatest Honor' |first=Adnan |last=Riaz |date=12 September 2015 |publisher=''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' |accessdate=22 November 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151119063952/http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/09/12/hannah-telle-involvement-in-life-is-strange-is-the-greatest-honor-2/166374/ |archivedate=19 November 2015 }}</ref><ref name="audition 2">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/videos/life-is-strange-episodic-heartstrings-kinda-funny-/2300-6425679/ |title=Life Is Strange: Episodic Heartstrings – Kinda Funny at E3 2015 |first=Jeremy |last=Jayne |date=18 June 2015 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=22 November 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151103172236/http://www.gamespot.com/videos/life-is-strange-episodic-heartstrings-kinda-funny-/2300-6425679/ |archivedate=3 November 2015 }}</ref>
[[File:Life Is Strange.gif|thumb|left|Key art for episode five from rough concept to final version.]]
Although it holds significant differences from ''Remember Me'', the game addresses similar themes of [[memory]] and [[Identity (philosophy)|identity]].<ref name="memoryidentity">{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/08/13/gamescom-2014-how-life-is-strange-gets-female-protagonists-right|title=Gamescom 2014: How 'Life is Strange' Gets Female Protagonists Right|first=Brian|last=Albert|date=13 August 2014|publisher=''[[IGN]]''|accessdate=11 November 2014|archivedate=12 November 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112052448/http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/08/13/gamescom-2014-how-life-is-strange-gets-female-protagonists-right|deadurl=no}}</ref> ''Life Is Strange'' was specified as an [[Analog device|analogue]] look at human identity in contrast to ''Remember Me'', the [[Digital media|digital]] view of the same theme.<ref name="analogue">{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-feature/2015/01/28/feature-life-is-strange-interview-and-hands-on-impressions|title=FEATURE: "Life is Strange" Interview and Hands-on Impressions|first=Nate|last=Ming|date=29 January 2015|publisher=''[[Crunchyroll]]''|accessdate=29 January 2015|archivedate=29 January 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150129193102/http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-feature/2015/01/28/feature-life-is-strange-interview-and-hands-on-impressions|deadurl=no}}</ref> Running on an improved version of [[Unreal Engine#Unreal Engine 3|Unreal Engine 3]], it makes use of the tools and special effects like [[High-dynamic-range rendering|lighting]] and [[depth of field]] engineered for ''Remember Me'' as well as subsequent advances.<ref name="characters" /><ref name="format" /> Visual effects like [[Image editing|post-processes]], [[Multiple exposure|double exposure]] and overlapping [[particle system|screen space particles]] were used as an artistic approach to be displayed while the lead character rewinds time.<ref name="obstacles">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/watch-life-is-strange-dev-talks-time-travel-butter/1100-6424849/ |title=Watch: Life is Strange Dev Talks Time-Travel Butterfly Effect in New Video |first=Eddie |last=Makuch |date=23 January 2015 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=24 January 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150125111127/http://www.gamespot.com/articles/watch-life-is-strange-dev-talks-time-travel-butter/1100-6424849/ |archivedate=25 January 2015 }}</ref> The textures seen in the game were entirely hand painted, adapted to achieve what art director Michel Koch called "impressionistic rendering".<ref name="rendering">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamereactor.eu/previews/249994/Life+is+Strange/ |title=One of the oddest reveals of Gamescom also proved to be one of the most interesting. Here's what the Remember Me developers did next. |first=Christian |last=Gaca |date=22 August 2014 |publisher=''[[Gamereactor]]'' |accessdate=11 November 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141221190043/http://www.gamereactor.eu/previews/249994/Life%2Bis%2BStrange/ |archivedate=21 December 2014 }}</ref> Elements were adjusted based on player feedback,<ref name="birth" /> with influences like ''[[The Walking Dead (video game)|The Walking Dead]]'', ''[[Gone Home]]''{{ref|1|1}} and ''[[Heavy Rain]]'' in mind.<ref name="analogue" /><ref name="influences">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/manifesto/juno--donnie-darko--gone-home--life-is-strange-30843#/slide/8|title=Juno + Donnie Darko + Gone Home = Life is Strange|first=Blake|last=Peterson|date=26 January 2015|publisher=''[[Game Revolution]]''|accessdate=29 January 2015|archivedate=29 January 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150129222908/http://www.gamerevolution.com/manifesto/juno--donnie-darko--gone-home--life-is-strange-30843#/slide/8|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> ''[[The Catcher in the Rye]]'' was an additional source of inspiration, whose protagonist [[Holden Caulfield]] shares a surname with Max, the game's lead.<ref name="catcher">{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2015/02/05/life-strange-director-talks-theme-identity-visual-novels/|title=Life Is Strange Director Talks About The Theme Of "Identity" And Visual Novels|date=5 February 2015|publisher=''Siliconera''|accessdate=6 February 2015|archivedate=10 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150210122205/http://www.siliconera.com/2015/02/05/life-strange-director-talks-theme-identity-visual-novels/|deadurl=no}}</ref> The characters were created using known [[archetype]]s, at first to establish an entry point for the player, and then to subvert them.<ref name="archetypes">{{cite web|url=http://www.idigitaltimes.com/life-strange-episode-2-dev-talks-us-about-whats-next-max-arcadia-bay-exclusive-424890 |title='Life is Strange Episode 2' Dev Talks To Us About What's Next For Max In Arcadia Bay [EXCLUSIVE] |first=Zulai |last=Serrano |date=23 March 2015 |publisher=''[[IBT Media#Assets|iDigitalTimes]]'' |accessdate=25 March 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150324104026/http://www.idigitaltimes.com/life-strange-episode-2-dev-talks-us-about-whats-next-max-arcadia-bay-exclusive-424890 |archivedate=24 March 2015 }}</ref> For the sake of serving the [[Realism (arts)|realism]], the supernatural elements were designed as a metaphor for the characters' inner conflict,<ref name="innerconflict">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamereactor.eu/news/288154/Life+is+Strange+-+%22Supernatural+things+merely+metaphors%22/ |title=Life is Strange – "Supernatural things merely metaphors" |first=Bengt |last=Lemne |date=26 January 2015 |publisher=''[[Gamereactor]]'' |accessdate=26 January 2015 |archivedate= 6 February 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150206225023/http://www.gamereactor.eu/news/288154/Life%2Bis%2BStrange%2B-%2B%22Supernatural%2Bthings%2Bmerely%2Bmetaphors%22/ |deadurl=no }}</ref> and experts were consulted to tackle the subject of teen suicide.<ref name="experts">{{cite web|url=http://www.polygon.com/2016/3/15/11226888/life-is-strange-gdc-2016 |title=How Life is Strange just might save lives — in-game and in real life |first=Allegra |last=Frank |date=15 March 2016 |publisher=''[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]'' |accessdate=24 March 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160318134333/http://www.polygon.com/2016/3/15/11226888/life-is-strange-gdc-2016 |archivedate=18 March 2016 }}</ref> ''[[Twin Peaks]]'' also influenced the setting and characters, and is referenced within the game.<ref name="LifeIsStrange">{{cite web | url=https://www.reddit.com/r/Games/comments/2tu8zx/life_is_strange_reddit_ama_with_the_dontnod_team/co2da1t | title=Life is Strange Reddit AMA with the DONTNOD team | date=27 January 2015 | accessdate=23 May 2015 | author=Koch, Michel}}</ref>
The score was composed by Jonathan Morali of the band [[Syd Matters]].<ref name="perspective">{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2015/01/29/life-is-strange-pc-ps4-xbox-one-video/|title=Life is Strange launch trailer and final dev diary released|first=Stephany|last=Nunneley|date=29 January 2015|publisher=''[[VG247]]''|accessdate=21 July 2015|archivedate=29 January 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150129233119/http://www.vg247.com/2015/01/29/life-is-strange-pc-ps4-xbox-one-video/|deadurl=no}}</ref> Inspired by modern [[indie folk]] music,<ref name="50%" /><ref name="highlighting" /> the soundtrack was intended to inform the mood of the game.<ref name="repercussion" /> The music contains a blend of licensed tracks and composed pieces.<ref name="50%">{{cite web|url=http://www.dualshockers.com/2014/10/09/life-is-strange-creative-director-jean-maxime-moris-talks-atmosphere-choices-and-female-leads/|title=Life Is Strange Creative Director Jean-Maxime Moris Talks Atmosphere, Choices, and Female Leads|first=Joel|last=Taveras|date=9 October 2014|publisher=''DualShockers''|accessdate=11 November 2014|archivedate=12 November 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112040959/http://www.dualshockers.com/2014/10/09/life-is-strange-creative-director-jean-maxime-moris-talks-atmosphere-choices-and-female-leads/|deadurl=no}}</ref> Featured artists include [[José González (singer)|José González]], [[Mogwai]], [[Breton (band)|Breton]], [[Amanda Palmer]], [[Brian Viglione]], [[Bright Eyes (band)|Bright Eyes]], Message to Bears, [[Local Natives]], Syd Matters, [[Sparklehorse]], [[Angus & Julia Stone]], [[alt-J]], Mud Flow<ref name="artists">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/these-are-the-songs-in-life-is-strange/1100-6425751/ |title=These Are the Songs in Life is Strange |first=Alexa Ray |last=Corriea |date=7 March 2015 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=7 March 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150309211114/http://www.gamespot.com/articles/these-are-the-songs-in-life-is-strange/1100-6425751/ |archivedate=9 March 2015 }}</ref> and [[Foals (band)|Foals]].<ref name="NAEU" />
==Release== Square Enix and Dontnod announced ''Life Is Strange'' on 11 August 2014.<ref name="direct">{{cite web|url=http://eu.square-enix.com/en/blog/announcing-life-strange|title=Announcing Life is Strange!|first=Toby|last=Palm|date=11 August 2014|publisher=''[[Square Enix]]''|accessdate=10 December 2014|archivedate=21 October 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141021194250/http://eu.square-enix.com/en/blog/announcing-life-strange|deadurl=no}}</ref> The episodes were released digitally on [[Microsoft Windows|PC]] via [[Steam (software)|Steam]], [[PlayStation 3]] and [[PlayStation 4]] via [[PlayStation Network]], and [[Xbox 360]] and [[Xbox One]] via [[Xbox Live]] between 30 January 2015 and 20 October 2015.<ref name="30 January 2015">{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/12/17/life-is-strange-gets-a-release-date-and-pricing-info|title=Life is Strange Gets a Release Date and Pricing Info|first=Wesley|last=Copeland|date=17 December 2014|publisher=''[[IGN]]''|accessdate=17 December 2014|archivedate=17 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150217003020/http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/12/17/life-is-strange-gets-a-release-date-and-pricing-info|deadurl=no}}</ref><ref name="20 October 2015">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamezone.com/news/life-is-strange-episode-5-release-date-revealed-in-new-trailer-3426071 |title=Life is Strange Episode 5 release date revealed in new trailer |first=Mike |last=Boccher |date=7 October 2015 |publisher=''[[GameZone]]'' |accessdate=12 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151010095519/http://www.gamezone.com/news/life-is-strange-episode-5-release-date-revealed-in-new-trailer-3426071 |archivedate=10 October 2015 }}</ref> In November 2014, the publisher said they were interested in releasing [[Video game packaging|physical copies]] of the game, but said that at that time they were "100 per cent focused on the digital release".<ref name="per cent">{{cite web|url=http://www.videogamer.com/ps4/life_is_strange/news/square_enix_considering_boxed_release_for_life_is_strange.html|title=Square Enix considering boxed release for Life is Strange|first=David|last=Scammell|date=19 November 2014|publisher=''[[VideoGamer.com]]''|accessdate=6 December 2014|archivedate=8 December 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141208080118/http://www.videogamer.com/ps4/life_is_strange/news/square_enix_considering_boxed_release_for_life_is_strange.html|deadurl=no}}</ref> One year later, the retail edition was set to be released for the PC, PS4 and Xbox One in North America on 19 January 2016 and in Europe on 22 January 2016; the [[Special edition|limited edition]] had an artbook, the soundtrack, score, and a director's commentary.<ref name="NAEU">{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/11/23/life-is-strange-limited-edition-coming-to-north-america-for-pc/178900/ |title=Life Is Strange Limited Edition Coming to North America for PC |first=Adnan |last=Riaz |date=23 November 2015 |publisher=''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' |accessdate=23 November 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151124115414/http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/11/23/life-is-strange-limited-edition-coming-to-north-america-for-pc/178900/ |archivedate=24 November 2015 }}</ref><ref name="score">{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/11/12/life-is-strange-limited-edition-announced/176838/ |title=Life is Strange Limited Edition Announced |first=Adam |last=Beck |date=12 November 2015 |publisher=''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' |accessdate=12 November 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151115010710/http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/11/12/life-is-strange-limited-edition-announced/176838/ |archivedate=15 November 2015 }}</ref>
A Japanese version was released for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 on 3 March 2016.<ref name="japanese">{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/12/10/life-is-stranges-japanese-version-receives-a-release-date/181870/ |title=Life Is Strange’s Japanese Version Receives a Release Date |first=Adnan |last=Riaz |date=10 December 2015 |publisher=''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' |accessdate=10 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151211050238/http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/12/10/life-is-stranges-japanese-version-receives-a-release-date/181870/ |archivedate=11 December 2015 }}</ref> [[Feral Interactive]] [[Porting#Porting of video games|ported]] ''Life Is Strange'' for [[OS X]], released on 16 June 2016,<ref name="mac">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/275134/Life_is_Strange_ndash_out_now_on_the_Mac_App_Store_Thecritically_acclaimed_Life_is_Strangetrade_is_now_available_on_theMac_App_Store_Life_is_Strange_is_a_unique_fivepart_adventure_thatexplores_complex_issues_with_an_innovative_take_on_storybased.php |title=Life is Strange – out now on the Mac App Store The critically acclaimed Life is Strange is now available on the Mac App Store! Life is Strange is a unique five-part adventure that explores complex issues with an innovative take on story-based |date=16 June 2016 |publisher=''[[Gamasutra]]'' |accessdate=16 June 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160922213029/http://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/275134/Life_is_Strange_ndash_out_now_on_the_Mac_App_Store_Thecritically_acclaimed_Life_is_Strangetrade_is_now_available_on_theMac_App_Store_Life_is_Strange_is_a_unique_fivepart_adventure_thatexplores_complex_issues_with_an_innovative_take_on_storybased.php |archivedate=22 September 2016 }}</ref> and [[Linux]],<ref name="porting">{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2016/06/01/feral-interactive-confirms-life-is-strange-is-coming-to-mac-linux/209664/ |title=Feral Interactive Confirms Life Is Strange is Coming to Mac, Linux |first=Adnan |last=Riaz |date=1 June 2016 |publisher=''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' |accessdate=2 June 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160602111105/http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2016/06/01/feral-interactive-confirms-life-is-strange-is-coming-to-mac-linux/209664/ |archivedate=2 June 2016 }}</ref> released on 21 July 2016.<ref name="linux">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/277641/Life_Is_Strange_is_out_now_on_Steam_for_Mac_and_Linux_withthe_first_episode_available_for_free.php |title=Life Is Strange is out now on Steam for Mac and Linux, with the first episode available for free! |date=21 July 2016 |publisher=''[[Gamasutra]]'' |accessdate=22 July 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160725161020/http://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/277641/Life_Is_Strange_is_out_now_on_Steam_for_Mac_and_Linux_withthe_first_episode_available_for_free.php |archivedate=25 July 2016 }}</ref> That same day, the first episode was made indefinitely available for free on Linux,<ref name="linux" /> Windows, OS X, PS3, PS4, Xbox 360 and Xbox One.<ref name="indefinitely">{{cite web|url=http://www.express.co.uk/entertainment/gaming/691827/Life-is-Strange-free-download-PS4-PS3-PlayStation-Plus-Xbox-One-Xbox-360-PC-Mac|title=Life is Strange free download confirmed for PS4 and PS3, regardless of PlayStation Plus|first=Liam|last=Martin|date=21 July 2016|publisher=''[[Daily Express]]''|accessdate=21 July 2016|archivedate=29 July 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160729212438/http://www.express.co.uk/entertainment/gaming/691827/Life-is-Strange-free-download-PS4-PS3-PlayStation-Plus-Xbox-One-Xbox-360-PC-Mac|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> ''Life Is Strange'' was included on [[PlayStation Plus]] for the month of June 2017.<ref name="strange killing">{{cite web|url=https://blog.eu.playstation.com/2017/05/31/killing-floor-2-and-life-is-strange-are-your-playstation-plus-games-for-june/|title=Killing Floor 2 and Life is Strange are your PlayStation Plus games for June|first=Matthew|last=Groizard|date=31 May 2017|website=[[PlayStation Blog]]|publisher=[[Sony Interactive Entertainment]]|archivedate=31 May 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170531172816/https://blog.eu.playstation.com/2017/05/31/killing-floor-2-and-life-is-strange-are-your-playstation-plus-games-for-june/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> It was released for [[iOS]] on 14 December 2017, and launches on [[Android (operating system)|Android]] in early 2018, both ported by [[Black Wing Foundation]].<ref name="GamesBeat-Dec2017">{{cite web|url=https://venturebeat.com/2017/12/12/life-is-strange-will-launch-for-ios-on-december-14/|title=Life is Strange will launch for iOS on December 14|first=Mike|last=Minotti|date=12 December 2017|website=[[GamesBeat]]}}</ref><ref name="Engadget-Dec2017">{{cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2017/12/12/life-is-strange-iphone-ipad-december-14th/|title='Life is Strange' comes to iPhone and iPad December 14th|first=Rob|last=LeFebvre|date=12 December 2017|website=[[Engadget]]}}</ref>
==Reception== [[File:GDC 2016 awards 16-20 52 32-01-7D1 0959 (25731583212).jpg|thumb|The developers accept the audience award at the 2016 [[Game Developers Choice Awards]].]] ''Life Is Strange'' received generally favourable reviews, with a Metacritic score of 85/100 on PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.<ref name="aggregated">{{cite web|url=http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/life-is-good-dontnod-on-the-success-of-life-is-strange-and-what-comes-next/0164045 |title=Life is good: Dontnod on the success of Life is Strange and what comes next |first=Alex |last=Calvin |date=15 March 2016 |publisher=''[[Market for Home Computing and Video Games|MCV]]'' |accessdate=16 March 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317064842/http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/life-is-good-dontnod-on-the-success-of-life-is-strange-and-what-comes-next/0164045 |archivedate=17 March 2016 }}</ref> While reviewers criticised the games's [[Lip sync#In video games|lip-syncing]]<ref name="lip sync 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.usgamer.net/articles/life-is-strange-episode-1-ps4-review-be-kind-rewind|title=Life is Strange, Episode 1 PS4 Review: Be Kind, Rewind|first=Mike|last=Williams|date=2 February 2015|publisher=''[[Eurogamer#Subsidiaries|USgamer]]''|accessdate=21 July 2015|archivedate=11 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150211212247/http://www.usgamer.net/articles/life-is-strange-episode-1-ps4-review-be-kind-rewind|deadurl=no}}</ref><ref name="lip sync 2">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamezone.com/videos/life-is-strange-episode-1-chrysalis-video-review-44v |title=Life is Strange Episode 1: Chrysalis Video Review |publisher=''[[GameZone]]'' |accessdate=22 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150906190802/http://www.gamezone.com/videos/life-is-strange-episode-1-chrysalis-video-review-44v |archivedate=6 September 2015 }}</ref><ref name="sleeper hit" /> and use of dated [[slang]],<ref name="sleeper hit" /><ref name="slang 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.polygon.com/2015/1/29/7945795/life-is-strange-review-xbox-one-ps4-360-ps3-PC-episode-one|title=Life is Strange: Episode One – Chrysalis review: so-called life|first1=Megan|last1=Farokhmanesh|first2=Colin|last2=Campbell|date=29 January 2015|publisher=''[[Polygon]]''|accessdate=10 March 2015|archivedate=30 January 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150130172551/http://www.polygon.com/2015/1/29/7945795/life-is-strange-review-xbox-one-ps4-360-ps3-PC-episode-one|deadurl=no}}</ref><ref name="slang ''Polarized'', had a "fitting conclusion" to the [[coming of age]] story of Max Caulfield and the relationship between the two leads was carried out successfully.<ref name="of age">{{cite web|url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/10/26/review-life-is-strange-episode-5-polarized/173583/ |title=Review: Life Is Strange Episode 5: Polarized |first=Adnan |last=Riaz |date=26 October 2015 |publisher=''[[Hardcore Gamer]]'' |accessdate=31 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151028195126/http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2015/10/26/review-life-is-strange-episode-5-polarized/173583/ |archivedate=28 October 2015 }}</ref><ref name="two leads">{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/life_is_strange_episode_5_-_polarized/b/playstation4/archive/2015/10/21/life-is-strange-episode-5-polarized-review-game-informer.aspx |title=Life is Strange: Episode 5 – Polarized |first=Kimberley |last=Wallace |date=21 October 2015 |publisher=''[[Game Informer]]'' |accessdate=31 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 October 2015 }}</ref> One stealth sequence was described as "tedious" and "out-of-place" while other aspects inhabiting the same course of events were favoured.<ref name="tedious">{{cite web|url=http://www.themarysue.com/life-really-is-strange/ |title=Review: Life Is Strange Episode 5: "Polarized" AKA Let's Have a Feels Trip |first=Jessica |last=Lachenal |date=21 ===Sales=== The first episode was ranked fifth among the best selling PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 video games of February 2015.<ref name="february sales">{{cite web|url=http://blog.us.playstation.com/2015/03/12/playstation-store-february-2015s-top-sellers/|title=PlayStation Store: February 2015's Top Sellers|first=Justin|last=Massongill|date=12 March 2015|publisher=''[[PlayStation Blog]]''|accessdate=12 March 2015|archivedate=15 March 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150315053212/http://blog.us.playstation.com/2015/03/12/playstation-store-february-2015s-top-sellers/|deadurl=no}}</ref> ''Life Is Strange'' reached one million sales in July 2015,<ref name="july sales">{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/07/23/life-is-strange-hits-1-million-sales-episode-4-release-date-announced |title=Life is Strange Hits 1 Million Sales, Episode 4 Release Date Announced |first=Luke |last=Karmali |date=23 July 2015 |publisher=''[[IGN]]'' |accessdate=23 July 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150725000242/http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/07/23/life-is-strange-hits-1-million-sales-episode-4-release-date-announced |archivedate=25 July 2015 }}</ref> having accumulated over 1.2 million unique players worldwide; the [[attach rate]] to units between the complete season and [[Season ticket#Other uses|season pass]] proved to be "extremely strong", divulged Square Enix.<ref name="unique players">{{cite web|url=http://www.polygon.com/2015/7/23/9022561/life-is-strange-episode-4-release-date-trailer |title=Life is Strange hits 1M copies sold, fourth episode coming next week |first=Samit |last=Sarkar |date=23 July 2015 |publisher=''[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]'' |accessdate=24 July 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150725015350/http://www.polygon.com/2015/7/23/9022561/life-is-strange-episode-4-release-date-trailer |archivedate=25 July 2015 }}</ref> The retail edition made seventh place in the top ten [[United Kingdom|UK]] game sales chart for the week ending 23 January 2016.<ref name="uk sales">{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-3-camps-at-top-of-uk-chart/1100-6434106/ |title=Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 Camps at Top of UK Chart |first=Tamoor |last=Hussain |date=25 January 2016 |publisher=''[[GameSpot]]'' |accessdate=26 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160128033016/http://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-3-camps-at-top-of-uk-chart/1100-6434106/ |archivedate=28 January 2016 }}</ref> ''Life Is Strange'' was one of the top 100 best-selling games on Steam in 2016.<ref name="dry ice">{{cite web|url=http://store.steampowered.com/sale/2016_top_sellers/ |title=Top 100 |website=[[Steam (software)|Steam]] |publisher=[[Valve Corporation]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170102152559/http://store.steampowered.com/sale/2016_top_sellers/ |archivedate=2 January 2017 }}</ref> As of May 2017, more than three million copies have been sold.<ref name="c0p135">{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2017-05-18-life-is-strange-2-finally-confirmed |title=Life is Strange 2 finally confirmed |first=Tom |last=Phillips |date=18 May 2017 |website=[[Eurogamer]] |publisher=[[Gamer Network]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170518213403/http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2017-05-18-life-is-strange-2-finally-confirmed |archivedate=18 May 2017 }}</ref><ref name="1nth3w0rk5" />

==Legacy== After ''Life Is Strange'' achieved financial and commercial success, Dontnod Entertainment started to become more prominent in the video game industry; publishers pursued the studio for the first time, whereas they previously had to pursue publishers themselves. CEO Oskar Guilbert said that the game saved his company financially after the mediocre sales of ''[[Remember Me (video game)|Remember Me]]''.<ref name="solicited success">{{cite web|url=http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/how-life-is-strange-changed-dontnod/0174354 |title=How Life is Strange changed Dontnod |first=Christopher |last=Dring |date=25 October 2016 |website=[[The Market for Computer & Video Games|MCV]] |accessdate=25 October 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161026080029/http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/how-life-is-strange-changed-dontnod/0174354 |archivedate=26 October 2016 }}</ref>
In July 2016, [[Legendary Entertainment|Legendary Digital Studios]] and Square Enix, in conjunction with dj2 Entertainment announced that they would be adapting ''Life Is Strange'' as a digital series.<ref name="adaptation">{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/legendary-tackling-adaptation-life-is-914899 |title=Legendary Tackling Adaptation of 'Life Is Strange' Video Game (Exclusive) |first=Borys |last=Kit |date=27 July 2016 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=27 July 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160728134633/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/legendary-tackling-adaptation-life-is-914899 |archivedate=28 July 2016 }}</ref> Legendary said that, at the time of the announcement, they were meeting with potential writers for the series adaptation, which would be set in Arcadia Bay.<ref name="writers">{{cite web|url=https://www.legendary.com/legendary-digital-studios-partners-with-square-enix-and-dj2-to-adapt-award-winning-episodic-videogame-life-is-strange-into-digital-series/|title=Legendary Digital Studios Partners with Square Enix and dj2 to Adapt Award Winning Episodic Videogame Life Is Strange into Digital Series|date=27 July 2016|publisher=''[[Legendary Entertainment]]''|accessdate=30 July 2016|archivedate=1 June 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170601063430/https://www.legendary.com/legendary-digital-studios-partners-with-square-enix-and-dj2-to-adapt-award-winning-episodic-videogame-life-is-strange-into-digital-series/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
On 18 May 2017, Dontnod Entertainment said ''[[Life Is Strange 2]]'' was in the works.<ref name="c0p135" /><ref name="sequel">{{cite web|url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2017/05/18/life-is-strange-sequel/ |title=Give me a hella yeah: more Life is Strange coming |first=Adam |last=Smith |date=18 May 2017 |website=[[Rock, Paper, Shotgun]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170518202319/https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2017/05/18/life-is-strange-sequel/ |archivedate=18 May 2017 }}</ref><ref name="1nth3w0rk5">{{cite web|url=https://www.destructoid.com/a-new-life-is-strange-game-is-in-the-works-436830.phtml|title=A new Life is Strange game is in the works|first=Ray|last=Porreca|date=18 May 2017|website=[[Destructoid]]|publisher=[[ModernMethod]]|archivedate=1 June 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170601064007/https://www.destructoid.com/a-new-life-is-strange-game-is-in-the-works-436830.phtml|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> It will have a new location and cast of characters.<ref name="n3w">{{cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/2015/6/24/8838761/life-is-strange-season-2-new-cast |title=Life is Strange's second season would star a new cast (if it happened) |first=Megan |last=Farokhmanesh |date=24 June 2015 |website=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]] |publisher=[[Vox Media]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161201154029/http://www.polygon.com/2015/6/24/8838761/life-is-strange-season-2-new-cast |archivedate=1 December 2016 }}</ref>
In early June 2017, developer [[Deck Nine]] said they had "signed a partnership deal with a leading AAA videogame publisher" and were developing a title for a "critically acclaimed franchise", and images of ''Life Is Strange'' characters appeared on Deck Nine's website.<ref name="pr3qu31">{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/images-of-apparent-life-is-strange-prequel-pop-up-1795732410|title=Images Of Apparent Life Is Strange Prequel Pop Up|first=Jason|last=Schreier|date=2 June 2017|website=[[Kotaku]]|publisher=[[Univision Communications]]|archivedate=1 June 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170601234323/http://kotaku.com/images-of-apparent-life-is-strange-prequel-pop-up-1795732410|deadurl=no}}</ref> Later that month, Square Enix announced ''[[Life Is Strange: Before the Storm]]'', a three-part episodic title that launched for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on 31 August 2017.<ref name="b3f0r3th35t0rm">{{cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/e3/2017/6/11/15779506/life-is-strange-prequel-before-the-storm-release-date|title=Life is Strange prequel Before the Storm debuts this summer (update)|first=Samit|last=Sarkar|date=11 June 2017|website=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]|publisher=[[Vox Media]]|archivedate=12 June 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170612033310/https://www.polygon.com/e3/2017/6/11/15779506/life-is-strange-prequel-before-the-storm-release-date|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
[[Titan Comics]] will release a four-issue comic book series based on ''Life Is Strange'' in 2018.<ref name="Knezevic-Mar2018">{{cite web|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/life-is-strange-comic-series-announced/1100-6457809/|title=Life Is Strange Comic Series Announced|first=Kevin|last=Knezevic|date=29 March 2018|website=[[GameSpot]]|archivedate=30 March 2018|archiveurl=http://archive.today/2018.03.30-030815/https://www.gamespot.com/articles/life-is-strange-comic-series-announced/1100-6457809/|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Notes== {{refbegin}} # {{note|1}}Dontnod started working on the game before ''Gone Home'' was released.<ref name="note2">{{cite web|url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/animationscoop/video-game-spotlight-life-is-strange-20141223|title=VIDEO GAME SPOTLIGHT: "Life Is Strange"|first=Cydney|last=Fisher|date=23 December 2014|publisher=''[[Indiewire]]''|accessdate=29 January 2015|archivedate=27 December 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141227162853/http://blogs.indiewire.com/animationscoop/video-game-spotlight-life-is-strange-20141223|deadurl=no}}</ref> # {{note|2}}The subtitle ''Chrysalis'' alludes to the [[Pupa#Chrysalis|transitional stage]] of butterflies as pupae, before they emerge into [[Butterfly|adulthood]].<ref name="note3">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/life-strange-episode-one-review-square-enix-gambles-female-protagonists-1801178|title='Life Is Strange' Episode One Review: Square Enix Gambles With Female Protagonists|first=Vincent|last=Balestriere|date=31 January 2015|publisher=''[[International Business Times]]''|accessdate=31 January 2015|archivedate=3 February 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150203032128/http://www.ibtimes.com/life-strange-episode-one-review-square-enix-gambles-female-protagonists-1801178|deadurl=no}}</ref> {{refend}}

{{Infobox video game |title = KGB
Conspiracy |image = [[Image:KGB-Box Art.jpg|256px|KGB]] |caption = Box art of ''KGB'' |developer = [[Cryo Interactive|Cryo]] |publisher = [[Virgin Interactive|Virgin Games]] |designer = [[Johan Robson]] |programmer = Yves Lamoureux |artist = Michel Rho |writer = Johan Robson |composer = [[Stéphane Picq]] |released = {{vgy|1992}} |genre = [[Adventure game|Adventure]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] |platforms = [[MS-DOS]], [[Amiga]] }} '''''KGB''''' is a [[video game]] released for the [[Commodore Amiga]] and [[IBM PC Compatible]] computers in 1992. Set in the decadent final days of the [[Soviet Union]], ''KGB'' is considered to be quite difficult, even for experienced gamers, since it relies on a real time clock and correct/wrong answers which can end the game immediately or after an event needed to be triggered; also, players may make errors which they will notice only hours later in-game. The game engine, graphics and interface have plenty of similarities with Cryo's [[Dune (video game)|''Dune'']]. ''KGB'' was also released on CD under the title '''''Conspiracy''''', which included clips of Rukov's father played by [[Donald Sutherland]] giving advice. In the CD version, all references to "KGB" within the game and manual were changed to "Conspiracy". == Plot == The game is set in the summer of 1991.{{r|matthews199302}} The protagonist, Captain Maksim Mikahilovich Rukov, recently transferred to the Department P from the [[Glavnoye Razvedyvatel'noye Upravleniye|GRU]] after three years' duty, is ordered to investigate possible corruption inside the [[KGB]] after a former agent turned private eye was found murdered. However, as the plot progresses, Rukov finds himself investigating a political plot of dangerous proportions. == Main characters == '''Captain Maksim Mikhailovich Rukov''' was born on 12 January 1966 in [[Yekaterinburg|Sverdlovsk]]. His parents, Mikhail Stepanovich Rukov and Svetlava Shailova, were killed on 23 May 1983 during an [[Afghanistan|Afghan]] [[terrorism|terrorist]] attack in [[Dushanbe]] (in the [[Tajik SSR]]) where his father was on active duty. Rukov learned [[English language|English]], [[Arabic language|Arabic]] and [[Spanish language|Spanish]] and joined the [[Spetsnaz]] as a [[paratrooper]] in 1988. The game begins as he makes his first steps in Department P. '''Uncle Vanya''' is the brother of Rukov's father. He was also injured in the attack and uses a wheelchair, but is still able to take care of his nephew. He seems very suspicious of Maks's new employers. (The name "Uncle Vanya" is a nod to [[Uncle Vanya|the play of the same name]] by [[Anton Chekhov]] {{Citation needed|date=October 2014}}) '''Major Vovlov''' is Rukov's direct superior at Department P. He is bad-tempered and authoritarian. '''Colonel Viktor Galushkin''' works at Department P. He personally knew Rukov's father and went after his assassins. '''Major Radomir Savinkov''', also a Department P member, is Rukov's controller in Leningrad. He is highly intelligent. '''Colonel Vladimir Kusnetsov''' is the head of KGB's Department 7 in Leningrad. He is very hostile to Department P. '''Captain Piotr Chapkin''' works at Department 7 with his father-in-law, Colonel Kusnetsov. '''Major Grigori Agabekov''' is second in command at Department 7. He served in Afghanistan. He has a clean record and good reputation. '''Nathaniel Greenberg''' and '''Carla Wallace''' are American CIA agents who happen to be working on the same case as Rukov. ==Reception== ''[[Computer Gaming World]]'' said in February 1993 that ''KGB'' "was very much in the [[John Le Carre]] mold, with lots of hidden intrigue, deep subterfuge and criss-crossing plot lines. One almost expects [[George Smiley]] to turn up". The magazine praised the game's graphics and "unusual feel", and concluded that it was "an engrossing and atmospheric product with more depth and attention to detail than offered by most of the latest graphic adventures".{{cite news|url=http://www.cgwmuseum.org/galleries/index.php?year=1993&pub=2&id=103 |title=Virgin's New Graphic Adventure, KGB |work=Computer Gaming World |date=February 1993 |accessdate=6 July 2014 |author=Matthews, Robin |pages=88 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140702235734/http://www.cgwmuseum.org/galleries/index.php?year=1993&pub=2&id=103 |archivedate=2 July 2014 }} In April 1994 the magazine said of the CD [[video game remake|remake]], ''Conspiracy'', that although Donald Sutherland's acting was "first-rate" the addition of his scenes to the original game was "a bit strained", concluding that "The novelty of seeing a Big Screen actor in an adventure game is about the only thing going for it".{{Cite magazine |last= |first= |date=April 1994 |title=Invasion Of The Data Stashers |department= |url=http://www.cgwmuseum.org/galleries/index.php?year=1994&pub=2&id=117 |magazine=Computer Gaming World |pages=20-42}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{moby game|id=/kgb|name=''KGB''}} * [http://thekgbfile.50webs.com/index.html Analysis of KGB's plot and characters] [[Category:1992 video games]] [[Category:Adventure games]] [[Category:Amiga games]] [[Category:Cold War video games]] [[Category:Cryo Interactive games]] [[Category:DOS games]] [[Category:Point-and-click adventure games]] [[Category:Spy video games]] [[Category:Murder in fiction]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]] [[Category:Video games set in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Video games set in 1991]]

{{Infobox video game | title = D4: Dark Dreams Don't Die | image = D4 Dark Dreams Don't Die cover art.jpg | developer = [[Access Games]] | publisher = '''Xbox One'''
[[Microsoft Studios]]
'''Microsoft Windows'''
